item.title: The Switch 2's Best Possible Port is 2023's Game of the Year
item.description:
The Nintendo Switch 2 has only been out for a few weeks, but third-party support for the handheld is already looking quite promising. Several multi-platform games that would have never been able to run on the original Switch, such as Elden Ring , Star Wars Outlaws , and the upcoming Madden NFL 26 , will be available on Nintendo's new console, thanks to its increased technical capabilities. The Switch 2 may not be as powerful as the PS5 or the Xbox Series X, but it should be able to play most of the major third-party games that those consoles support.

While Nintendo has secured a compelling lineup of titles for the Switch 2 so far, there are some notable absences from the console's library. Lately, there's been a demand for the release of native Switch 2 ports for games such as Death Stranding: Director 's Cut , Tekken 8 , Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5+2.5 Remix , Persona 3 Reload , and Metaphor: ReFantazio , but none of these games have been officially announced for the system yet. It would be great, of course, to have as many games as possible on the Switch 2, but if there's one title that should be prioritized for the system above all else, it's Baldur's Gate 3 .

Baldur's Gate 3 on Nintendo Switch 2 Seems Like an Easy Win for Larian Studios

Baldur's Gate 3 Was One of 2023's Best Games

Baldur's Gate 3 was one of the most widely acclaimed games of 2023. Set in the world of the Forgotten Realms, a Dungeons and Dragons campaign setting, BG3 is a turn-based CRPG in which choice and consequence play a major role in defining a player's story. Despite a lengthy run in early access, Baldur's Gate 3 blew up in popularity and sold millions of copies across PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

Since Baldur's Gate 3 Can Run on the Steam Deck, It Can Probably Run on the Switch 2 as Well

Baldur's Gate 3 is an ambitious game that's chock-full of content, but it's not a particularly demanding one. While the game does require a decent PC, it can run on a wide variety of low-end configurations, including those of PC handhelds. On the Steam Deck, for instance, Baldur's Gate 3 can run at a stable 30 FPS at low graphical settings, and although it can drain the system's battery, it can be completed from start to finish on the handheld without any glaring technical hiccups. The only feature in Baldur's Gate 3 that struggles to run on the Steam Deck, however, is split-screen co-op.

The Xbox port of Baldur's Gate 3 was infamously delayed for three months because Larian Studios wasn't able to get the game's split-screen co-op function running on the Series S. Earlier this year, it added support for this feature on the console.

Since the Nintendo Switch 2 is relatively comparable in power to the Steam Deck, a game like Baldur's Gate 3 should be able to run perfectly fine on the system. That said, it's hard to say if Larian Studios is actually interested in supporting Nintendo's new console. Throughout its existence, the company hasn't really bothered to port most of its games to Nintendo platforms and has instead opted to support PC, PlayStation, and Xbox devices.

Divinity: Original Sin 2 is the first, and currently, only Larian game that's available on a Nintendo console, as it was released on the original Switch in 2019. Plus, BG3 isn't even available on the first Switch console.

A Nintendo Employee Was Involved in the Development of Baldur's Gate 3

Shortly after Baldur's Gate 3 's release in August 2023, there was some speculation among fans that a Switch 2 port of the game was already in development. A few keen-eyed players noticed that Etsushi Iizuka, a veteran developer at Nintendo, had been given a shoutout in the 'Special Thanks' section of the game's credits.

Since almost all the games that Iizuka had worked on had appeared on a Nintendo console before, many assumed that he must have been involved in the production of an unannounced Switch 2 version of Baldur's Gate 3 . Although nothing has come of these claims so far, they will hopefully end up being true in the long run.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Enemy Hoards Ridiculous Number of Potions
item.description:
An Oblivion Remastered player was shocked to discover that a single Boethia's Chosen was hoarding over a hundred Strong Potions of Healing. While there are several ways to make money in Oblivion Remastered , potions have always been one of the most valuable things that players can loot – if their carry weight is taken into account. By that same virtue, Alchemy has also been a traditional moneymaker, as it allows the Hero of Kvatch to gather a bunch of cheap ingredients to produce lucrative potions.

However, certain enemies can be uncharacteristically generous with their loot, such as goblins having hundreds of arrows in their possession. A common misconception is that Luck in Oblivion Remastered affects drop rates, but the reason why enemies are sometimes stacked with loot is due to a leveling bug. Instead of resetting their entire inventory whenever the player gains a level, some enemies keep getting new items added on top of their old ones.

This is certainly the case with Boethia's Chosen, an enemy type that players will encounter when doing the Boethia quest in Oblivion . As seen on Bornwithoutaface6yo's post, a single Boethia's Chosen can carry 118 Strong Potions of Healing, each worth up to 149 Septims. Other items affected by this bug in Oblivion Remastered include enchanted arrows, making Boethia's quest an extremely profitable affair if started as late as possible.

Oblivion Remastered Player Discovers Over a Hundred Potions on an Enemy

Due to how level scaling works in Oblivion Remastered , it's generally preferred for players to hold off on completing certain quests. This especially applies to the main quest, as the Hero of Kvatch can obtain one of the most powerful items in the game if they hold off on progressing through The Path of Dawn until Level 22. Other notable enemies that come with stacked inventories include the Priests of Order from Shivering Isles, holding multiple Hearts of Order on their person.

While Septims become trivial at higher levels in Oblivion Remastered , the value of having Strong Potions of Healing or enchanted arrows is not to be underestimated. Assuming the Hero of Kvatch hasn't maxed out their Alchemy in Oblivion , the big advantage that pre-made healing potions have is that their restoration effect is instant. This quality allows the player to dodge life-ending scenarios, making Strong Potions of Healing an essential item for adventuring. It remains to be seen if further Oblivion Remastered updates will ever fix this bug, but many players would likely argue that the loot system works just fine.

item.title: All Tamagotchi Plaza Codes (& How to Redeem Them)
item.description:
As players might've noticed while exploring through the menus in Tamagotchi Plaza , they can put up decorations in their home's Committee Room and on the King Tamahiko I statue in the town square. However, at the start of the game, they will have no decorations available, so they won't be able to do it.

To remodel the Committee Room and the King Tamahiko I statue, players must get their hands on some decorations, which are unlocked by redeeming codes. This guide will show players how to redeem codes in Tamagotchi Plaza and will list every available code as well.

How to Redeem Codes in Tamagotchi Plaza

Players can redeem codes and unlock free goodies that'll help them decorate their home and the square. To redeem a code in Tamagotchi Plaza , gamers must open their mobile phone by pressing X on the controller, and then open the Code app - the third app on the right, represented by three white squares with an A and a B inside the first two squares. In the Code app, players will have to select the Gift option and then enter a valid six-digit code.

All Codes in Tamagotchi Plaza

At the time of writing, there is only one code available in Tamagotchi Plaza . However, these are still the early stages of the game, and more are bound to be released soon. Players can get a free cassette tape in Tamagotchi Plaza by inputting the following character combination in the Code app:

  • S2r7tm

This code will unlock the "That One Song" cassette tape, which gamers can play in the Committee Room. To do it, they have to open the Remodeling app and select the cassette tape section in the Committee Room tab . The video below shows players how the entire process of redeeming codes works in Tamagotchi Plaza :

item.title: Dune Awakening: All Unique Gear in Hagga Rift
item.description:
Dune Awakening features a large map filled with regions to explore and new resources to accumulate. One of these regions is the Hagga Rift, which stretches for a long distance from Vermillion Gap to the Shield Wall. It's a dark and gloomy area with a lot of enemy outposts and camps that you can visit. Some of these outposts contain unique gear schematics that you can collect to craft powerful weapons and equipment for your character. So, here's the location for all of these unique schematics.

All Hagga Rift Unique Gear Schematic Locations in Dune Awakening

There are over 30 unique gear schematics that players can find in the Hagga Rift region of Dune: Awakening . These schematics are scattered across nine different locations both in and around the Hagga Rift, so it's recommended that players use a fast vehicle like a Sandbike or an Ornithopter to make the journey.

In addition to the vehicle arrangement, make sure to equip the best gear and weapons on your character, as most of these locations will be swarming with enemies . It's best to venture into these locations prepared for a fight.

item.title: Ark Ascended Gets New Update for June 2025
item.description:
Another Ark: Survival Ascended update is now available to download on PC and consoles, debuting in the final days of June 2025. Identified by version number 67.49, this release is almost entirely focused on bug fixes, though it also tackles one Ark: Survival Ascended exploit.

October 26 will mark the second anniversary of Ark: Survival Ascended launching in early access on PC before its preview version expanded to the Xbox Series X/S and PS5 the following month. Ever since then, the Ark: Survival Evolved remaster has been receiving regular updates, ranging from minor hotfixes to wide-ranging content drops. This newest release from Studio Wildcard belongs to the former group.

The latest Ark: Survival Ascended patch rolled out on Friday, June 27, bumping the game's version number up to 67.49 and delivering a slate of bug fixes. The update tackles issues focused on milestone progression, visual glitches, and creature behavior, among other aspects of the popular MMO survival crafting game.

Among the bugs tackled by the update are several issues affecting in-game progression, including milestones related to Ark: Survival Ascended boss fights, gunpowder crafting, and silica pearls. Some of these newly patched problems were introduced in the massive 67.00 update, which introduced a new version of the Ragnarok map to the early access remaster on June 19. For instance, large beaver dams will now properly count toward looting milestones on the Ragnarok map. On a similar note, Astraeos' Astral variants will now count toward Alpha creature Milestone progression, as they were intended to from the outset.

Other fixes arriving as part of the new Ark: Survival Ascended patch include a solution for a bug that caused shoulder pets to turn invisible, as well as revised animations for swimming creatures. Instances where newly hatched dinosaurs appear stuck or show incorrect level data have been eliminated as part of this release. Studio Wildcard also patched some selective problems with the paint preview system, as well as functionality issues related to the Dino Export feature. Moreover, some unexpected hotbar behavior concerning custom cosmetic structures has been resolved.

Next Ark: Survival Ascended Content Drop Is Scheduled for August 2025

The latest version of the game also eliminates a singular exploit, according to its official changelog, which doesn't elaborate on the matter any further. The 67.49 patch is the tenth update that Ark: Survival Ascended has received in June 2025, arriving just five days after the 67.35 release. According to Studio Wildcard's previously shared content roadmap, its next big content drop is scheduled for August 2025, when the game will receive the Valguero Ascended map for free, together with a community-voted creature and a Fantastic Tame. More minor patches in the vein of the 67.49 release are expected in the meantime.

Ark: Survival Ascended Update 67.49 Patch Notes

  • Fixed several Milestones not progressing correctly, this includes Boss Fights, Silica Pearls and Gunpowder crafting
  • Ragnarok's large beaver dams now count towards the looting beaver dam Milestones
  • Astraeos' Astral variants now count towards Alpha creature Milestones
  • Fixed paint preview not appearing correctly when painting some items
  • Fixed Dino Export option not working correctly
  • Fixed Shoulder Pets sometimes turning invisible
  • Fixed cases where creatures appear as level 1
  • Fixed creatures getting stuck when hatched from the Egg Incubator
  • Fixed several creatures not playing their correct swimming animation
  • Fixed an issue that caused the inability to remove custom cosmetic structures from the hotbar
  • Fixed an issue that prevented placing multiple custom cosmetic structures on the hotbar
  • Fixed an exploit
